results.title: Talk it over
results.creator_credit: Brereton Porter and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film, produced for adult education, illustrates the importance of the free interchange of information and ideas in the maintenance of a free society. The object of the film is to encourage logical method in the examination of ideas and in the clear formulation and definition of points at issue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brereton Porter and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Talk
results.creator_credit: Doug Wilcox, Roger Owen and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early years at school”
Stresses the importance of talking as a medium of communication for children aged three to nine years regardless of whether or not it takes the standard middle-class form.
Suitable for teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Tales of the riverbank: morning mist
results.creator_credit: Paul Sutherland, McGraw-Hill Films and Riverbank Productions
results.brief_description: Hammy awakens to find that the river outside his house looks as though it were on fire. He decides to investigate, and heads upstream in a motor boat. He is soon engulfed in a white cloud, but the sun breaks through - it is the morning mist. Lost in a strange cave, Hammy is eventually rescued by Roddy and Guinea Pig.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Sutherland, McGraw-Hill Films and Riverbank Productions

results.title: Tales of gods and demons
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
Describes the history of the masked ballet performed by Thai dancers. Explains the dance drama Ramakein and the myths and legends from which it originates.

results.title: Taleb and his lamb: a Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility.
results.creator_credit: Ami Amitai, Amitai Film Productions and Barr Films
results.brief_description: This film is subtitled, “A Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility. “The tale is about Taleb, a shepherd’s son, who has a pet lamb from his father’s flock. Taleb steals the lamb, after it is taken to the market to be sold for slaughter, and hides in the desert with it. The angry father finds them, but how the story ends is left up to the viewer to decide.
results.title_for_label: Taleb and his lamb: a Bedouin tale about right and wrong - discipline and responsibility.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ami Amitai, Amitai Film Productions and Barr Films
